alert.note: Alert for El Paso; Hudspeth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued January 08 at 1:49PM CST until January 08 at 3:45PM CST by NWS El Paso
info.description: The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico... Southeastern Luna County in southwestern New Mexico... Southern Dona Ana County in south central New Mexico... Hudspeth County in western Texas... El Paso County in western Texas... * Until 245 PM MST. * At 1245 PM MST, an area of blowing dust was over West El Paso. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong winds up to 55 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in Texas between mile markers 1 and 17, and between mile markers 20 and 134. Highway 54 in in El Paso County. Highway 9 in southern Dona Ana and Luna Counties. Locations impacted include... West El Paso, East El Paso, Central El Paso, Northeast El Paso, Far East El Paso, Mission Valley, Tornillo, Sierra Blanca, Clint, Horizon City, Dell City, Columbus, Allamoore, Loma Linda, Fabens, Chaparral, Santa Teresa, Anthony, Desert Haven, and Hueco Tanks. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
